jason.stdlib

Class desire

  • java.lang.Object
    • jason.asSemantics.DefaultInternalAction
      • jason.stdlib.intend
        • jason.stdlib.desire
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InternalAction, java.io.Serializable

    public class desire
extends intend

    Internal action: .desire(D).

    Description: checks whether D is a desire: D is a desire either if there is an event with +!D as triggering event or it is a goal in one of the agent's intentions.

    Example:

    • .desire(go(1,3)): true if go(1,3) is a desire of the agent.
    See Also:
    intend, drop_all_desires, drop_all_events, drop_all_intentions, drop_intention, drop_desire, succeed_goal, fail_goal, current_intention, suspend, suspended, resume, Serialized Form

      • execute

        public java.lang.Object execute(TransitionSystem ts,
                       Unifier un,
                       Term[] args)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: InternalAction
        Executes the internal action. It should return a Boolean or an Iterator. A true boolean return means that the IA was successfully executed. An Iterator result means that there is more than one answer for this IA (e.g. see member internal action).

        execute in interface InternalAction
